intro: Rourea bamangensis, commonly known as the Bamangensis Rourea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Cameroon and the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
